newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Labour slips in latest opinion poll.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Labour slips in latest opinion poll.

text.p: The opposition Labour Party's opinion poll lead has slipped by three points in the past week, narrowing its advantage over the ruling Conservatives to 18 points, a poll for Friday's Independent newspaper showed.
The Harris poll put support for Labour at 49 percent, down from 52 percent on April 11, while the Conservatives were up one point at 31 percent.
The minority Liberal Democrats were at 13 percent, up one point.

The poll also showed that more than a quarter of voters said they may change their mind before the May 1 election. Conservative supporters were more inclined to be waverers than Labour's, with 30 percent saying they may switch by polling day, compared with 17 percent of Labour voters.
Nearly half of the Liberal Democrats' supporters, 45 percent, said they may change their minds.
Harris interviewed 1,136 voters face to face in their homes between April 11 and 14.
